notes: Common fermented maize porridge widely consumed; maize is a key staple in Nigeria (FAO background)
Chicken dishes (stew/fried) use poultry raised on maize+soy feed; indirect GMO link via feed
Eggs from layers commonly fed maize+soy; omelettes are direct human meal

country_or_region: Popular street food made from cowpea paste; Nigeria commercialized GMO cowpea (PBR cowpea)

notes: Traditional dish made from cowpea paste; links to GMO cowpea adoption in Nigeria
Common Nigerian dish; rice base with vegetable oil blends that may contain soybean
Chicken feed relies on maize and soy; dish combines rice base with poultry products linked to GMO feed
Cattle feed in Nigeria often includes maize and soybean meal
Staple dish made from cassava flour (gari or fufu); GMO cassava varieties under research but not yet commercialized
Common food made from fermented cassava granules; no approved GMO cassava yet but trials ongoing
Instant noodles widely consumed in Nigeria; main ingredient wheat flour plus seasoning oils that may include soybean or palm oil
Yam porridge typically cooked with vegetable oil blends that may contain soybean or cottonseed oil
Popular pastry that may include meat from animals fed on maize and soy and flour blends that may include maize
Common Nigerian stew base cooked with vegetable oil blends that may include soybean or cottonseed oil
